content.description: Probably my favorite of this bunch. Start on the right side of the large "block". Climb up a shallow, right facing corner/groove on the ledge. Climb the steeper face up and then slightly right where you'll encounter two very cool slanting cracks in the rock. Use these to gain the upper ledge. Finish up and right using the left facing corner and some pockets on the face. Anchors on the left. NOTE - There's a large crack formed by a big rock off to the right. I've yarded on this rock and it seems solid for now but I opted NOT to include this in any route. Just leave it alone.
content.protection: Glue In Bolts, Lower Off Anchor
content.location: Conditions Note! This section required some serious digging and cleaning and honestly still needs some more dirt work down low. No exaggeration that more than a dump truck worth was probably sent down. Cleaning requires a remove, let dry, repeat process and things have been damp. Hoping some traffic will help move this along a bit faster. Climbable for sure but not my usual standard of clean so preemptive apologies. Please continue to wear helmets as well. The area above the anchors slopes and while I put in a LOT of hours up there, I'm sure a buzzard could send something down if the planets aligned.

content.description: Just left of Bow Legged Women.Start right of Dr JoJo.  Pull up onto the first large ledge using good holds.  Clip a high bolt off the ledge and then pull up into the slot before clipping a 3rd bolt and climbing up to the base of the headwall (4th bolt just below small stance).  Clip another high bolt and make the crux moves though the "blankness" into a thin left facing corner/flake.  continue up and slightly left past more bolts to the anchor.  Mussy Lower off.

Climb up the most vertical part of this "lower block" to gain the stepped and still dirty ledge JUST RIGHT of the tree. Surmount this headwall with the tree just off your left shoulder. Continue up very cool, featured rock to the next ledge. Move up and slightly left towards the vertical weakness. Climb the steep headwall to the anchors out left (tricky clipping the anchor, no "Bomber" jug up there).
content.protection: Glue In Bolts, Lower Off Anchor
content.location: Conditions Note - This section required some serious digging and cleaning and honestly still needs some more dirt work down low. No exaggeration that more than a dump truck worth was probably sent down. Cleaning requires a remove, let dry, repeat process and things have been damp. Hoping some traffic will help move this along a bit faster. Climbable for sure but not my usual standard of clean so preemptive apologies. Please continue to wear helmets as well. The area above the anchors slopes and while I put in a LOT of hours up there, I'm sure a buzzard could send something down if the planets aligned

content.description: Start just right of Purulent. Climb up the slab on good rock to the headwall. Surmount the headwall using the crack on the right and/or left edge to gain the next ledge. Climb past the next steep section on white, freshly cleaned rock to the next ledge. Easy climbing up highly featured rock leads to the last stance in an alcove with anchors on the left.
content.protection: Glue In Bolts, Lower Off Anchor
content.location: Conditions Note!!    This section required some serious digging and cleaning and honestly still needs some more dirt work down low. No exaggeration that more than a dump truck worth was probably sent down. Cleaning requires a remove, let dry, repeat process and things have been damp. Hoping some traffic will help move this along a bit faster. Climbable for sure but not my usual standard of clean so preemptive apologies. Please continue to wear helmets as well. The area above the anchors slopes and while I put in a LOT of hours up there, I'm sure a buzzard could send something down if the planets aligned.

climbs.name: Here's to Swimming With Bow Legged Women

content.description: Probably the Best Route at Med Wall.  Fun moves, good rock and a great position make this one hard to beat.
content.protection: Glue In BoltsChains w/Steel Biners for lowering at the top.

content.description: One right of Bow Legged. Climb over the lower roof bulge past one bolt onto the first ledge. Follow bolts up easier climbing to the base of the headwall where it bulges out. Climb up the steep  "prow"on small pockets between Bow Legged and Cute  to the top.  Same anchor as for Cute Without the E.
content.protection: Bolts   Shares anchors (Mussy Hooks) with Cute without the E.

content.description: Scramble up easy rock to the right of Texas Caterpillar. Pull through some harder moves heading up and right of the "chossy chunk" area of the wall. The meat of this climb follows three bolts off the ledge up the steep headwall.

Probably the 2nd best line on NT after Bow Legged.  MIGHT even be the best.   

  Head up past the cave and into a shallow groove past 2 bolts before pulling onto the grassy ledge. (Some gardening should clean that ledge up).  Pull past the bulge, onto easier ground heading up and slightly right towards the base of the overhanging, left facing corner.  Climb up the corner on edges and pockets before reaching a small crack near the top.
content.protection:
Bolts 

  Mussy Hooks Anchor to lower.
content.location: On the far right side of NT

climbs.name: The Cheeks
climbs.fa: Bolted by Matt Markell - Open Project 12/2020

content.description: New Full Length Route. TR anchors were put in years prior but were chopped during the great shutdown. Now fully installed. Climb up the initial steep rock right of Cute w/o E start. Pull onto the first ledge (tree roots and dirt). Surmount the second wall section and take easier climbing to the base of the steep headwall below “the cheeks”. Hard boulders moves through the headwall takes you to the anchors. Lower Off.

Begins down on the lower ground (lots of fresh dirt). Climb up easy ledges and broken rock between the two trees to the base of the headwall with dual cracks. Tricky moves through the overhanging cracks gets you onto the ledge. Climb up and right into a still-needs-some-cleaning groove using better holds on the left face. Gain the next ledge. Con't up and slightly left to the final headwall below a small flake/finger crack. Bouldery crux up high gets you to the anchor which is a bit tricky to clip.
content.protection: Glue In Bolts, Lower Off Anchor
content.location: Conditions Note!  This section required some serious digging and cleaning and honestly still needs some more dirt work down low. No exaggeration that more than a dump truck worth was probably sent down. Cleaning requires a remove, let dry, repeat process and things have been damp. Hoping some traffic will help move this along a bit faster. Climbable for sure but not my usual standard of clean so preemptive apologies. Please continue to wear helmets as well. The area above the anchors slopes and while I put in a LOT of hours up there, I'm sure a buzzard could send something down if the planets aligned.

content.description:
Fun, clean rock and moves up to an overhanging and slightly more dirty corner.

 Climb lower angled "stepped" rock near the base to the first bolt. Follow good rock up and left along a left leaning ramp past a second bolt. Continue up past the third bolt making fun face moves to top out on a ledge (4-5th). Climb easier featured rock straight up (6th) heading towards the obvious, overhanging corner above.

 Climb up into the the overhanging corner past two more bolts to the anchor.

 The upper-most section sees some drainage. It's been heavily brushed but will still need more traffic to get it really clean. Get on it as the moves are pretty fun!
content.location: Currently the rightmost route on New Testament.

content.description: New Testament is the right side of the wall that makes up the "Testaments".  New Testament is generally things RIGHT of the group of trees found at the base of the wall.
